entry.title: Celebrating two Decades of Excellence: Atos Honored with SAP‚Äôs Golden Certificate
entry.content:
For the tenth consecutive time, Atos had its SAP global operations and services certified and, as a result, has been awarded SAP‚Äôs prestigious Golden Certificate. This makes Atos only the second global partner to receive this special recognition ‚Äì a testament to the exceptional consistency and quality of their performance. As part of our partner ecosystem, Atos contributes to a group of globally certified partners recognized for consistently meeting SAP‚Äôs high standards across all regions. Their broad expertise across SAP solutions and their integration continues to earn our trust and respect. We deeply value our enduring partnership and appreciate Atos‚Äôs willingness to share their insights and experiences as a trusted, SAP-certified operations partner.

 

SAP: Atos positions itself as a pioneer in leveraging SAP Business Suite, cloud ERP, and AI to drive efficiency and innovation. What sets your approach to digital transformation apart from other providers, and how do you deliver measurable value across technologies for different industries?

Atos: New-age, AI-powered solutions from SAP are the core of our approach. Our strategy is to leverage platform capabilities from SAP BTP and hyperscalers to enable extended business solutions for application and business transformation. We provide value by leveraging comprehensive industry insights alongside our tailored industry solutions, consulting expertise, and transformation frameworks - all supported by advanced automation.

Our customers benefit from risk-mitigated transformation, cost-effective solutions, and increased user satisfaction by leveraging the full potential of SAP Business Suite on Cloud. Service Transformation is a key aspect of our approach for Application Management Services (AMS), where we leverage Joule for Developers, SAP Build process automation, and clean core with Atos Code-Pilot for custom-code reverse engineering.

 

SAP: What motivated you to pursue global certification for one of your services for the first time in 2004, and how do you reflect on that decision today?

Atos: Our strategy has always focused on achieving global presence and global recognition. To make that a reality, we set out to be globally certified with SAP in 2004. Now, with 20 years of continuous Global Certification across all key domains, we believe our decision has strengthened our business, enhanced customer trust, and supported SAP through robust partnerships, increased credibility, and expanded service offerings.

 

 

SAP: Since your initial certifications, you have expanded your global certification scope over the years. Not only have you re-certified your original certifications multiple times, but you have also added several new ones. Atos has recently renewed its five global certifications: SAP S/4HANA solutions operations, SAP SuccessFactors solutions operations, SAP HANA operations, SAP BTP operations, and DevOps. What role do the certifications, including the audit, play in your service offering?

Atos: Certifications have enabled us to identify areas for improvement in our offerings and recognize the strengths of Atos‚Äôs capabilities and services. Each certification cycle has resulted in the development of more comprehensive solutions that address customers‚Äô IT transformation needs. Additionally, certifications assist in aligning our work with SAP‚Äôs product roadmap and preparing for future developments.

 

 

SAP: To what extent are the certifications helpful in your marketing activities and your communication with customers? Do you actively reference your global certifications when engaging with new customers?

Atos: Yes, we do highlight our certifications to new and existing customers. It helps in proving that we possess the right capabilities, offerings, experience, and follow SAP standards for each phase of the application management lifecycle. Certification showcases our credibility in the market, both to customers and our other partners in the SAP ecosystem (e.g., Microsoft, Amazon, Google).

 

Information on the certification program for operations partners and an overview of all certified partners can be found in the SAP Operations Partner Guide.

Visit OPC at SAP.com

üì¢Installation & Upgrade Guide for SAP Data Services üõ†Ô∏è

üí°When installing or upgrading, compatibility questions are bound to arise since we deal with different databases, drivers, applications and other components.

Compatibility Checklist

‚úÖ Ensuring a Certified Environment To confirm compatibility with your target (new) version of SAP Data Services, verify the following:

üîçInformation platform services (IPS) / Business Intelligence Platform (BIP)
üîç Operating System
üîç Database (Repository / Source & Target)
üîç Drivers
üîç Browser
üîç Cloud Platforms
üîç Cloud Storage
üîç Message Client Library
üîç Etc.

Understanding the Compatibility Legend

üåüMake sure you understand its legend, as it is crucial to proceed:

  • For example: If item y was certified in version 4.x SPx Patch x, it will be considered as supported/compatible for that version and above until the version being mentioned as deprecated in the PAM in the future.

üñ•Designer Client Tool

Application client tool, named as Designer, needs to be under the same version, support pack and Patch of SAP Data Services Job Server to avoid any compatibility within the Job Server and CMS (component from IPS/BI application).

Because of this need for harmony, the Designer tool can't share a machine with another BI/IPS installation, even if you're not using that CMS connection for SAP Data Services. But don't worry! If you need IPS/BI installed, just make sure it's compatible according to our compatibility matrix.

üîó 3322026 - Can BOE/BI/IPS Platform Client Tools and Designer Client Tool coexist in the same machine? - SAP Data Services

üìöUseful Resources

Each SAP product has its Product Availability Matrix (PAM) and Maintenance Strategy. For more information on how to access these, check out the KBA below:

üîó 1338845 - How to find Product Availability Matrix (PAM) / Supported Platforms Documentation for SAP BusinessObjects products (BI/IPS, DS, IS)?

Visit the SAP Data Services for detailed information on Installation, Upgrade, and Migration steps. Remember to change the documentation version to your desired SAP Data Services version.

Recommendation

üí° We strongly recommend installing/upgrading to the latest certified version between IPS/BIP and SAP Data Services to avoid any known issues that have been fixed.

  • If upgrading is not possible, before proceeding with the installation or upgrade, check the Release Notes for that version under the SAP Knowledge Base. There might be known issues that could affect your daily work.
  • This will help you identify and be prepared to apply any available workaround!

üåüIf you have any questions or need assistance, feel free to reach out to SAP Support and search under our Knowledge Base!

entry.title: SONDA Gallery is SAP Certified for SAP BTP with Generative AI Capabilities
entry.content:
Artificial intelligence is rapidly transforming enterprise software, bringing smarter automation, contextual insights, and enhanced user experiences to business-critical systems. In tax and accounting, where precision and compliance are essential, AI is helping organizations to manage complex data with greater agility and confidence. As regional SAP ICC representative and having worked closely with SAP Partners on their solutions' certification projects, I‚Äôve seen firsthand how solutions that combine generative AI with robust platforms like SAP are redefining usability and performance. These innovations go beyond automation, delivering intelligent assistance tailored to the evolving demands of modern finance teams.

SONDA, an SAP partner with headquarters in Chile and strong presence in Brazil, has been a driving force in digital transformation across the Americas. With expertise in tax management, SONDA delivers solutions to help companies navigate regulatory complexity and operational challenges through a portfolio of SAP-based solutions, automation and process integration.

Among these, SONDA Gallery stands out as a tax-accounting solution for Brazil. Originally co-innovated with SAP in 2016 and built natively on SAP HANA, Sonda Gallery is designed to support Brazilian tax legislation with high performance and real-time data analysis. Evolving the solution across the time to adopt SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) and integrated with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (SAP DRC), the solution now features generative AI capabilities, including a virtual assistant trained on product documentation. This assistant helps users navigate the system, summarize notes, translate content, and identify key deliverables‚Äîbringing a new level of intelligence to their tax management solution.

Sonda has been a long time SAP partner and has regularly certified its solutions with SAP Integration and Certification Center (SAP ICC) support. Since 2020 Sonda Gallery has been following SAP strategy toward taxes for Brazil and being SAP Certified, initially through an SAP Tax Declaration Framework for Brazil (SAP TDF) scenario, and later through an SAP DRC for Brazil scenario. With the new Built with SAP BTP Utilizing Generative AI Hub Capabilities (BTP-EXT-GenAI) certification scenario Sonda identified an opportunity to reposition and offer customers with a solution based on SAP BTP and using SAP Business AI, that is now tested against SAP Global AI Ethics Policy requirements.

However, the certification criteria did not initially account for Sonda Gallery‚Äôs ABAP-based authentication model, which relied on SAP Logon Tickets and classic ABAP objects. Rather than delay the process, SONDA responded with remarkable speed and precision. In just two weeks, the company re-engineered Sonda Gallery‚Äôs authentication to fully adopt SAP BTP Cloud Identity services, a modern and secure mechanism native to SAP BTP platform. This migration not only met the certification requirements but also enhanced the solution‚Äôs flexibility, to provide enhanced identity and access management (IAM) across both SAP and Microsoft environments.

Completing the certification on time was a testament to SONDA‚Äôs technical agility and deep understanding of SAP architecture. It also reinforced the company‚Äôs commitment to delivering future-ready solutions that meet the highest standards of security, usability, and compliance, tested through SAP Certification. With this achievement, SONDA Gallery is now officially SAP Certified with SAP Business AI, positioning it as a solution that is taking advantage of the latest technologies provided by SAP for the benefit of our joint customers.

entry.title: Advance Your Career as a Certified SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Project Manager
entry.content:
Around 60% of cloud buyers told IDC‚Äôs Cloud Pulse Survey in October 2024 that their business‚Äô IT or digital infrastructure currently requires major transformation, and 82% said their cloud also requires modernization. In response to these pressing industry needs, effective project management has become essential, particularly for navigating complex cloud-based initiatives. The new certification for SAP Certified Associate - Managing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Projects (C_S4PM2) provides a unique opportunity for professionals to become certified project managers, equipping them to lead transformative digital efforts with expertise and strategic insight. 

Designed for Project Managers, Consultants, and Technical Leads, this certification empowers you to excel in managing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition implementations, positioning you to become a strategic leader in your organization's digital strategy, providing direction and specialist knowledge in project execution. 

How to prepare for this certification 

You can prepare for the exam in your own pace, by completing the "Managing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Projects" learning journey, designed to provide comprehensive insight into SAP S/4HANA Cloud project management. With free access to the learning journey, you can deepen your expertise of managing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition projects, spotlighting SAP tools and strategic implementation methodologies. Among these, the RISE with SAP Methodology stands out as a vital, holistic approach tailored for cloud transformation journeys. 

Additionally, SAP Community blog posts provide some supporting information to deepen your understanding and preparation: 

  • 12 Things that SAP implementation methodology SAP Activate tells you to do 
  • Planning your System Conversion to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition following SAP Activate 
  • SAP Activate for RISE with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition now available by Deployment Journey 
  • Conversion Guide for SAP S/4HANA 2023 for SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2023
  • Review the SAP Activate Minute videos in this playlist. 

You can also explore more insights about SAP Activate for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition on SAP for Me, and take a look at the release notes.  

As a prerequisite, candidates should possess project management experience, preferably in ERP implementation, especially SAP Cloud-related projects. Additionally, hands-on experience with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition solutions, knowledge of SAP Cloud ALM, and experience managing cloud-based SAP projects are beneficial.

Get started today 

Achieving the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition certification allows you to become a crucial asset in driving your organization's growth and innovation. This certification validates your 

competency in integrating business goals with technical solutions, enhancing your leadership role in cloud project management.  

Certified learners must regularly update their skills and keep certifications valid by completing mandatory annual assessments before expiration. With an SAP Learning Hub subscription, you can take these assessments anytime during your certification's validity.  

Build the skills you need on the‚ÄØSAP Learning site‚ÄØand get inspired by reading learner stories on‚ÄØSAP Community, ask questions and connect with fellow learners. When you‚Äôre ready, take your certification exam and start shaping your industry's future!‚ÄØ

entry.title: Your Step-by-Step Guide to SAP Sales Cloud V2 Certification
entry.content:
The SAP Certified Associate - Implementation Consultant - SAP Sales Cloud Version 2   exam is designed for professionals who want to demonstrate their ability to configure, implement, and use the  new SAP Sales Cloud solution. With organizations increasingly relying on cloud-based sales tools, this credential sets you apart as someone who can deliver value through modern, intelligent sales processes.

If you‚Äôre planning to pursue this certification, here‚Äôs a structured roadmap using the official resources available.

Step 1: Start with the Learning Journey

Your first stop should be the Learning Journey: Implementing SAP Sales Cloud V2. This guided path introduces you to the fundamentals and provides structured exercises to practice key business user and configuration skills.

The Learning Journey covers the essentials:

  • Daily workflows for sales representatives and managers
  • Core capabilities and navigation of Sales Cloud V2
  • Machine learning fundamentals and generative AI overview
  • Integration with Microsoft Teams and mobile app functionality

By following it through, you‚Äôll gain both conceptual understanding and practical hands-on experience.

Step 2: Join the ‚ÄúGet Certified‚Äù Live Session Series

Next, enroll in the ‚ÄúGet Certified: SAP Certified Associate ‚Äì Implementation Consultant ‚Äì SAP Sales Cloud V2‚Äù live session series. These structured, expert-led sessions are designed to complement your independent study with:

  • A Kickoff session (1 hour), which walks through exam format, question types, preparation strategies, and sample questions

  • A series of five additional 1-hour sessions, each focusing on key Learning Journey units

By participating, you gain direct guidance from certified trainers, reinforce your understanding of the most exam-relevant content, and practice with realistic sample questions‚Äîall of which are invaluable for aligning study with exam demands.

Step 3: Optional Microlearning Videos for Just-in-Time Insights

If you‚Äôd like to reinforce particular areas or learn on the go, consider exploring the bite-sized microlearning videos  in the Sales Cloud V2 category. These videos are concise, accessible, and perfect for filling knowledge gaps just when you need it.

Step 4: Hands-on Practical Test (Required to Unlock Exam Booking)

Before you can book the certification exam, SAP requires proof of hands-on competence. This is fulfilled by the ‚ÄúDemonstrating the Value of SAP Sales Cloud Version 2‚Äù practical test within your Learning Journey. 

If you have gone through the Learning Journey exercises, this step should be straightforward. The tasks in the test are based on what you‚Äôve already practiced, making it a natural extension of your preparation. Once passed, the ‚ÄúSchedule Exam‚Äù button becomes available, allowing you to book your certification exam. 

Step 5: Prepare for the Certification Exam

Next, focus your preparation on the exam content itself:

  • Implementation basics and clean-core principles
  • Master data management (accounts, contacts, products, pricing)
  • Sales processes including leads, opportunities, contracts, quotations, and orders
  • User management, personalization, and security
  • Use this framework to guide your revision and ensure full coverage.

Step 5: Practice and Review

After completing the learning resources, reinforce your knowledge through practice:

  • Revisit exercises in the Learning Journey

  • Test yourself with sample exam questions, if available

Consistent review will help you move from memorization to confident application of concepts.

Final Thoughts

The path to SAP Sales Cloud V2 certification is clear when you use the right resources. Start with the Learning Journey, take advantage of quarterly expert sessions and study according to the exam guide. By combining structured learning with consistent practice, you‚Äôll be ready to validate your expertise and move forward as a trusted SAP Sales Cloud consultant.

entry.title: From Movie Theater to Global Stage: How a "Gully Boy" Moment Changed Everything
entry.content:
In a darkened movie theater in Amsterdam, Nagesh Polu made a decision that would seem absurd to most people. Fifteen minutes into the film, he'd already guessed the ending (he is an avid movie goer, so this happens often). So, he did what any dedicated learner would do‚Äîhe pulled out his phone and started studying SAP SuccessFactors materials instead.

"That's probably the weirdest place I've ever studied," Nagesh laughs, "but it perfectly captures who I am. I can't waste a moment when there's something new to learn."

Nagesh's story begins in Chirala, India, where he earned his bachelor's degree. His parents had instilled in him what he calls a "do-or-die mindset"‚Äîa philosophy that would prove prophetic.

 

"My father taught me that success isn't just about personal achievement," Nagesh reflects. "It's about lifting your family and extended family along with you. Living simply, staying cheerful, standing by our people‚Äîthese weren't just values, they were survival strategies.‚Äù Those early years built something invaluable: resilience. Little did he know that this small-town foundation would eventually support a career spanning continents and transforming global enterprises.

Starting as a sales trainee, Nagesh eventually found himself at YASH Technologies, working with traditional SAP HCM presales teams and constantly hitting walls. During one particularly frustrating project estimations discussions, a senior consultant delivered advice that would change everything: "If you really want to shape the future, learn SAP‚Äîit's where the biggest challenges and opportunities are."

But it was SAP's acquisition of SuccessFactors that created Nagesh's true "lightbulb moment." While others saw a complex transition, he saw infinite possibility. What happened next was nothing short of extraordinary.

SAP Learning Hub became Nagesh's compass‚Äîhis "go-to resource for quickly building knowledge and completing prerequisites." The comprehensive training, hands-on exercises, and certification preparation materials became the foundation of his transformation. The breakthrough came during a late-night session in his Amsterdam home office. He was trying to build a complex report. Hours of trial and error had left him exhausted and frustrated. Then, using the detailed training materials and practical examples from SAP Learning Hub, it clicked. "I sat there thinking, 'I can build anything with this.' The rush was incredible‚Äù, he remembers.

Here's where Nagesh's story takes a surprising turn. He expected SAP learning to be purely technical‚Äîa skills upgrade to advance his career. Instead, it transformed something he never anticipated: his ability to think like a business leader. The intensive learning journey wouldn't have been possible without key support. Nagesh credits his wife as his anchor, whose unwavering support at home enabled his relentless pursuit of learning without interruption and his mentors across his journey.

Colleagues began noticing that Nagesh brought both big-picture strategy and hands-on expertise to projects. He wasn't just solving technical problems; he was solving business problems.

As Nagesh accumulated SAP Certifications‚Äî through rigorous study with SAP Learning Hub‚Äîeach one became what he calls "another layer of armor."

"Every SAP Certification reinforced my ability not only to tackle complex projects but also to lead others through them," he shares. "They weren't just credentials‚Äîthey were confidence multipliers."

The SAP Certifications opened doors to high-impact global assignments and helped him earn client trust more quickly. But the real transformation was internal: from a small-town graduate to a leader who could walk into any boardroom with complete confidence.

Then came the career-defining moment that validated years of relentless learning. A global client was facing a high-stakes SAP SuccessFactors implementation with a brutal deadline. Their previous attempts had failed. The pressure was immense. Nagesh delivered.

"When their CHRO told me that our solution had transformed how they manage talent worldwide, all those years of learning‚Äîincluding those movie theater study sessions‚Äîsuddenly made perfect sense," he recalls. Today, Nagesh's learning journey continues to impact others in unexpected ways. He's mentored colleagues through their first SAP Certifications, elevated his entire team's capabilities, and regularly shares insights through blogs that help the wider SAP community.

 "My learning journey has been consistent, persistent, and purpose-driven," he notes. "It should be as natural as checking your messages or having your morning coffee."

When asked what movie would capture his learning journey, Nagesh's answer is immediate: "Gully Boy‚ÄîApna time aayega" (Our time will come). It perfectly captures his philosophy: that with persistent learning and unwavering commitment, anyone from anywhere can rise to extraordinary heights. entry.title: Certification as a Catalyst: How Minsait Drives SAP Excellence in Brazil
entry.content:
Our partner Minsait, a company of the Indra Group, has established itself as a benchmark in digital transformation and SAP operations in Brazil. In this exclusive interview, the company shares how its long-standing commitment to SAP certifications has shaped its strategy, strengthened customer trust, and positioned it uniquely in the market. From pioneering SAP BTP operations in Brazil to driving innovation with AI, sustainability, and data-driven solutions, Minsait explains how it helps customers unlock the full potential of the SAP ecosystem ‚Äî and what strategic priorities will guide the next chapter of its growth. We highly appreciate our enduring collaboration with Minsait and their openness in sharing valuable insights and experiences as a trusted SAP-certified operations partner.

 

Would you like to start by telling us about your company and the services MINSAIT offers?

Minsait, a company of the Indra Group, is a leader in new digital environments and disruptive technologies, with a global presence and strong operations in Brazil. Our portfolio covers everything from strategic consulting to the implementation and management of mission-critical solutions, with a focus on delivering tangible business results. We operate across the entire value chain, offering consulting, systems integration, custom development, cybersecurity, automation, artificial intelligence, and application management services.

In the SAP ecosystem, we support companies through end-to-end journeys ‚Äî from defining the strategy, implementing digital transformation projects, migrating to SAP S/4HANA, and operating complex environments, to leveraging innovations such as SAP BTP, AI, Industry 4.0, and sustainability.

 

Minsati joined the certification program for operations partner in 2010 - what was the deciding factor behind this decision?

From the beginning, we understood that SAP certification was not just a label, but a competitive differentiator to reinforce our customers‚Äô trust. By joining the program in 2010, our goal was to prove ‚Äî with SAP‚Äôs endorsement ‚Äî the quality and maturity of our SAP operations and support processes. The certification was also seen as a public commitment to global best practices, aligning our operations with the highest standards in the market.

To what extent has this certification been helpful in your marketing efforts and in your communication with customers?

The certification is a powerful tool in building credibility. In the sales process, it serves as concrete proof that we follow SAP-recognized standards and have proven capabilities to deliver high-quality services. It also differentiates Minsait in competitive bids and RFPs, strengthening our position as a trusted partner for strategic projects and mission-critical operations.

  

MINSAIT has recently received certification for SAP BTP operations in Brazil for the first time. What significance does SAP BTP hold for MINSAIT and its customers? And to what extent did the audit support your SAP BTP strategy?

SAP BTP is far more than a technical platform ‚Äî it is a central pillar of our digital transformation strategy for customers. It enables us to create extensions, intelligent integrations, automations, and advanced data and analytics solutions, enhancing the value of the SAP core while keeping it clean (clean core). In practice, this means transforming ERP systems into intelligent, scalable platforms ready for continuous innovation.

The importance of this achievement is even greater because Minsait is only the second company in Brazil to obtain the SAP BTP operations certification. This reinforces our position as a trusted partner frequently recommended to support customers in complex and strategic BTP projects. This trust is no coincidence ‚Äî it is the result of a solid track record of more than 180 SAP BTP developments and success stories, covering integration, automation, extension, and analytics scenarios for clients across various industries.

When combined with other high-profile certifications such as CMMI, TMMi, SAP BTP Operations, and SAP S/4HANA Solutions Operations, this achievement places Minsait in a unique position: we are the only Brazilian company with this set of certifications, demonstrating our unmatched strength in development quality, testing, and SAP operations management.

The audit played a key role in further strengthening our BTP strategy. It validated practices, highlighted our strengths, and pointed to areas for improvement ‚Äî such as test automation, observability, and standardization of operations across multiple environments. We have incorporated these recommendations into our roadmap, enabling us to further raise our maturity level and ensure every BTP delivery is a benchmark for quality and innovation in the market.

 

Minsait and SAP team at the audit in July 2025

 

SAP consistently aligns its strategy with the cloud and encourages partners to actively support customers during their migration journey. What distinguishes your company in this regard, and how do you support your customers in their digital transformation?

Our differentiator lies in the combination of experience, proximity to our customers‚Äô business, and multidisciplinary technical expertise. We work with agile methodologies, proprietary tools, and accelerators that reduce project time and migration risks. Furthermore, we don‚Äôt just migrate systems to the cloud ‚Äî we ensure that this move delivers real business value, integrating data, artificial intelligence, automation, and clean core practices.

This consultative, results-oriented approach enables us to accelerate SAP innovation adoption, ensuring that each customer gets the most from their cloud investment.

 

How do your SAP certifications reflect your strategy and position in the Brazilian market?

The achievement of SAP BTP Operations certification in Brazil, along with the renewal of our SAP S/4HANA Solutions Operations certification, is not just a technical milestone ‚Äî it is a symbol of our continuous evolution and the trust we have earned from SAP and our customers.

Since joining the certification program in 2010, our strategy has been clear: align our processes with the most demanding global standards while maintaining the agility and proximity required by the Brazilian market. Over the years, this approach has established us as a reference in SAP application management and the execution of high-complexity projects, always focusing on quality, security, and business results.

The fact that we are the only Brazilian company to hold certifications such as CMMI, TMMi, and the certifications for SAP BTP operations and SAP S/4HANA solutions Operations reinforces our robustness and organizational maturity. This allows us to consistently deliver value, whether in complex implementations, cloud migrations, critical integrations, or the ongoing management of mission-critical environments.

Our commitment for the coming years is to continue innovating, anticipating trends, and helping our customers get the most out of the SAP ecosystem ‚Äî always with the security of having a certified, experienced, and results-driven partner.

 

Looking ahead, what are your strategic priorities in your partnership with SAP? Are there specific areas within SAP‚Äôs portfolio ‚Äì such as AI, sustainability, industry cloud, or further expansion in SAP BTP ‚Äì where you see growth opportunities or plan to invest?

Our strategic priorities are focused on six major pillars:

First, we are expanding our SAP BTP expertise, using it as a platform for innovation, automation, and seamless data integration. We are also applying Artificial Intelligence directly to business processes, leveraging SAP AI Core and AI Hub capabilities as well as partnerships with leading technology providers. Sustainability and ESG are deeply embedded in our portfolio, with solutions that enable customers to measure, reduce, and report their environmental and social impact. At the same time, we support the responsible and fast adoption of SAP S/4HANA, ensuring that customers who have not yet migrated can make the transition securely and with clear added value. Another key focus is the Business Data Cloud (BDC), which reinforces our commitment to transforming our customers‚Äô data into strategic and monetizable assets. Finally, through Intelligent AMS, we combine advanced monitoring, automation, and predictive analytics to reduce incidents and maximize performance.

entry.title: One Hour, One Habit, One Champion: Kunal Bansal‚Äôs Lifelong Learning Story üèÜ
entry.content:
Ask Kunal Bansal what the most powerful skill in his career has been, and he won‚Äôt say coding, consulting, or communication - he‚Äôll say consistency. Every single day, no matter where he is, he dedicates one hour to learning. That one habit has not only shaped his expertise but also inspired hundreds of others to start their own learning journeys. 

Q: Paint us a picture of who you are beyond work. What would we find you doing on a Saturday morning? What‚Äôs something about you that might surprise your colleagues? 

Saturday mornings start with badminton with friends and afternoons mentoring rural students. Supporting underprivileged learners keeps me grounded and reminds me why learning matters. 

I spend at least an hour daily learning. It‚Äôs as natural as breathing, but far more rewarding. Mentoring isn‚Äôt just a hobby; it‚Äôs my passion. Networking and talking to people across industries taught me business processes, the foundation that made SAP technology click for me. 

Q: Take us inside a typical business day. What makes you excited to get up in the morning, and what frustrates you? 

My day begins with a workout at the gym. My favorite and happiest hour. After that come leadership calls on people and skill management for our SAP CX practice, followed by client project calls. 

Tea, lunch, and walks with colleagues mix jokes, work talk, and wisdom. 
What frustrates me? Seeing colleagues stuck in a non-learning, non-growth mindset. 
What excites me? Helping them flip the switch and grow. 

Q: Tell us about the moment you decided to learn SAP. What sparked that decision? 

I started my career in the SAP Student Training and Rotation program - clueless, wide-eyed, and wondering how to survive in this massive ocean. My mentor, Ramakrishna, told me something that shaped my entire journey: ‚ÄúStart with basics and learn business processes, not systems.‚Äù 

Q: What was your biggest ‚Äòaha!‚Äô moment? 

Back in 2016, I was working on SAP CRM and SAP Marketing Cloud. When I finally understood the CRM business process, the dots connected. 

I realized that technology wasn‚Äôt just moving data. It was orchestrating the heartbeat of a business. That shift turned me into a trusted advisor to customers and the go-to person for technical and business challenges. 

Q: What was the hardest part of your learning journey? 

Opening SAP Learning Hub for the first time felt like entering a massive library without a map - overwhelming! 

I remembered my mentor‚Äôs advice: start from basics, learn business processes first. Once I did, the chaos turned into clarity. That persistent learning turned me from a rookie into a recognized community voice. 

Q: What surprised you most about the learning process? 

Answering Q&A and writing blogs on SAP Community accelerated my learning more than I expected. 

Contributing consistently for over seven years helped me become a community influencer and built my personal brand as a subject matter expert which eventually led to my selection as an SAP Champion.  

Q: What‚Äôs something you can do now that you couldn‚Äôt before? 

Previously, I used to explain SAP technology in dense technical jargon, regardless of the audience. Now, I adapt my speech according to the target audience as below:
  • Developers: features, APIs, and architecture 
  • Consultants: flows, modules, and configuration 
  • Executives: business impact and how the Intelligent Enterprise helps companies run smarter 

This shift makes me more effective in stakeholder discussions, project planning, and skill development. 

Q: Looking back, what advice would you give your younger self or someone just starting their SAP journey? 

To my younger self, I‚Äôd say: ‚ÄúStart with basics, business processes, then explore SAP modules.‚Äù 

To newcomers: first understand real-world business challenges and processes, then learn Intelligent Enterprise concepts and SAP Business Suite flows. Everything else falls into place. 

Q: How has your learning impacted others at work or beyond? 

My journey has inspired juniors, peers, and even seniors to seek guidance for their SAP learning. 

Outside work, this led to invitations to podcasts, panels, and SAP events as a speaker. It also strengthened my credibility and reinforced my position as a thought leader in the SAP ecosystem. 

At this point, friends and colleagues joke: ‚ÄúJust Google his name, you‚Äôll find him.‚Äù 

Q: What‚Äôs been your proudest moment? 

Being recognized as one of SAP Champions worldwide was surreal and humbling. But I‚Äôm equally proud of helping colleagues grow, guiding careers, and creating a culture of continuous learning within my practice. 

Q: Bonus question: what‚Äôs the weirdest place you‚Äôve ever studied SAP? 

Definitely old bookshops on Bangalore‚Äôs streets, while hunting for novels. They gave me strange looks but for me, learning can happen anywhere. 

Q: And if your SAP learning journey were a movie? 

‚ÄúLearning Is Lifelong.‚Äù The moment you think you‚Äôve mastered it all, the technology changes and you realize you‚Äôre still a student. 

Kunal‚Äôs advice to every SAP learner: 

‚ÄúStart with what businesses need, not what buttons to click. SAP understanding, certifications and success will follow.‚Äù 

Ready to carve out your own daily hour? Explore learning journeys and certifications on the SAP Learning site  and see how far curiosity can take you.

entry.title: Strengthening Security on SAP BTP Neo Environment with DigiCert Global Root G3
entry.content:
At SAP, keeping your data and applications secure is always a top priority.
To further strengthen the security of the SAP BTP Neo environment, we are migrating to the ‚ÄúDigiCert Global Root G3‚Äù Public Key Infrastructure (PKI). This update ensures long-term trust, improved encryption, and compliance with the latest international security standards.

Do You Need to Do Anything

For most customers, no action is required.
Modern web browsers (like Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox) and up-to-date operating systems already trust the new DigiCert Global Root G3 certificate automatically.
